intro: Ceropegia denticulata, commonly known as the toothed ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant produces distinctive, white or pale yellow flowers that are often visited by specific pollinators. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a serrated edge, contributing to its common name. Ceropegia denticulata is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and unique floral structure.
